meanings.definition: Of or relating to an atom.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the atomic structure of the element.
meanings.sent2: The atomic model helped explain how atoms interact with each other.
meanings.sent3: The atomic theory made the students' heads spin in confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of atomic science was as solid as the nucleus of an atom.
meanings.sent5: The atomic properties of the substance were fascinating to observe.

meanings.sent1: The atomic particles were too tiny to be seen with the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted an atomic detail on the miniature canvas.
meanings.sent3: The atomic size of the insect amazed the curious child.
meanings.sent4: His patience was as atomic as the smallest particle known to man.
meanings.sent5: The atomic dimensions of the cell were crucial for its function.

meanings.definition: Involving energy resulting from a nuclear reaction.
meanings.sent1: The atomic bomb released a tremendous amount of destructive energy.
meanings.sent2: The scientists worked on harnessing atomic power for peaceful purposes.
meanings.sent3: The atomic explosion in the movie was both thrilling and terrifying.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the atomic blast was felt for miles around.
meanings.sent5: The atomic energy source provided electricity to the entire city.
